summary: Valentine’s Day themed multi-page website with romantic messages and photo galleries across 4 pages.
architectural_notes: Website will have 4 pages with Valentine’s Day themed color scheme and text/photo content per page.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Soft repeating heart pattern background in blush/rose tones (valentine-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Romantic bouquet of flowers photo-style image, warm lighting, shallow depth of field (flowers.dim_1200x800.png)
- Simple heart icon favicon, flat design, red/rose palette (favicon-heart.dim_64x64.png)

existing_features.title: Create a 4-page Valentine’s Day themed website with consistent romantic styling (colors, typography, layout) across all pages.
Implement Page 1 (landing page) with the exact long message provided by the user and display the 1st and 4th uploaded images: IMG_20260123_022920_162.jpg and IMG_20260123_022853_008.jpg.

Implement Page 2 with the heading text exactly: "some of the countless memories that we had in the last 8 months" and show a gallery of additional uploaded photos (excluding the two used on Page 1 and excluding the photos reserved for Page 4). Use these images on Page 2: IMG_20260110_001106_333.jpg, IMG_20260123_022956_194.jpg, IMG_20260123_022822_917.jpg, IMG_20260123_023006_342.jpg.

Implement Page 3 with a flower photo and the text exactly: " I will always have all the gift that u gave Mee in my heart ". Use a generated flower image asset (see Image Requirements) for the flower photo.

Implement Page 4 as a gallery containing the remaining uploaded photos (all uploaded images not shown on Pages 1 and 2): IMG_20260123_022914_736.jpg, IMG_20260123_022814_325.jpg, IMG_20260123_022756_879.jpg, IMG_20260118_135409_239.jpg, IMG_20260123_022932_300.jpg.
Add simple navigation between the 4 pages (e.g., top nav and/or next/previous buttons) so the site can be viewed sequentially on mobile and desktop.
Add all uploaded images to the frontend as static assets and reference them by filename in the pages specified above (do not serve images through the backend).

Render the generated images listed in Image Requirements from frontend static assets (frontend/public/assets/generated) and use them in the UI (background/fallback visuals) consistently with the theme.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Valentine’s Day themed multi-page website (4 pages) with specified messages and photo placement per page.

projectName: Valentine’s Day 4-page website with themed design and photo galleries
